duck: Exponential distribution, a family of continuous probability distributions
Exponential family, sometimes used in place of "exponential family"
Matrix exponential, the matrix analogue to the above
exponential definition: of or relating to an exponent.
Exponential notation, also known as scientific notation, or standard form
Exponential Technology, a vendor of PowerPC microprocessors
Exponential type or function type, in type theory
Exponential discounting, a specific form of the discount function, used in the analysis of choice over time
Exponential decay, decrease at a rate proportional to value
Exponential growth, where the growth rate of a mathematical function is proportional to the function's current value
Exponential smoothing, a technique that can be applied to time series data

milestones: Saskatchewan places moratorium on boar farming, says escaped boars should be killed
VeriSign acquires Weblogs.com
Russian and US satellites collide
Irish scientists had predicted further Sumatran earthquake
MPAA sues six BitTorrent sites linking to TV shows
Belgian Indymedians discuss participatory journalism at open door day
Social networking site lets users run virtual campaign for US president
Interview with Jimbo Wales
Randall Munroe, writer of xkcd, talks about the comic, politics and the internet
Hospitality exchange organisation grows to 100,000 members
Wikimedia Conference Netherlands 2007 held on wikis and education

where the growth rate of a mathematical function is proportional to the
function's current value *Exponential map, in differential geometry *Exponential
notation, also known as scientific notation, or standard form *Exponential
object, in category theory *Exponential time, in complexity theory *in

probability distributions **Exponential family, sometimes used in place of
